description.value:
Holy warriors, local champions, or obsessed avengers. Paladins draw powerful magic by swearing a magical oath. They heal and deal devastating damage with radiant attacks.

The following is a revised version of the 5e paladin class. Our revisions support archery and dual wielding for paladins, as well as reworking ability progression, channel abilities, and a few of the class's features. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the paladin class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#paladin]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Paladins

When you create a level 1 Paladin, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 16   &reference[Dexterity]: 8   &reference[Constitution]: 14   &reference[Intelligence]: 8   &reference[Wisdom]: 12   &reference[Charisma]: 16 

or

Strength: 16   Dexterity: 10   Constitution: 14   Intelligence: 10  Wisdom: 12   Charisma: 14  

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per paladin level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Wisdom], &Reference[Charisma]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Intimidation], &Reference[Medicine], &Reference[Persuasion], and &Reference[Religion]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.ZOyejSDAVAH74Z4u]{longsword} and a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield} -OR- a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons} and a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield} -OR- two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}

  • five @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.pM8eu7VlKCHmEi3N]{javelins} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS#simple-melee-weapons]{Simple Melee Weapons}

  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.sgcCg8pGXKBu3f4S]{chain mail} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.QhHQy7whejLOVFf8]{scale mail}
  • a holy symbol
  • a priest's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a paladin level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level paladins gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For paladins you must have:

  • Either Strength: 14 or Dexterity: 14

  • Charisma: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per paladin level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}

Paladin Advancement

advancement.title: Fighting Style
advancement.hint: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options from the appropriate class list. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

advancement.title: Divine Health
advancement.hint: The magic flowing through you makes you immune to disease.

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a longsword and a large shield -OR- a Martial Weapon and a large shield -OR- two Martial Weapons

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose five javelins -OR- any Simple Melee Weapon

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 2nd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 3rd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 4th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 5th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Alternative Smite Options
advancement.hint:
Just like with Divine Smite, each of these smite options deal damage that counts as part of your weapon's damage, and they count as spells. 

At level 2, choose one of the following smite options. You gain another option at levels 5, 9, and 13.

advancement.title: Alternative Smite Options
advancement.hint:
Just like with Divine Smite, each of these smite options deal damage that counts as part of your weapon's damage, and they count as spells.

Choose one of the following smite options or one of the smite options available at earlier levels. You gain another option at levels 9 and 13.

advancement.title: Alternative Smite Options
advancement.hint:
Just like with Divine Smite, each of these smite options deal damage that counts as part of your weapon's damage, and they count as spells.

Choose one of the following smite options or one of the smite options available at earlier levels.

advancement.title: Alternative Smite Options
advancement.hint:
Just like with Divine Smite, each of these smite options deal damage that counts as part of your weapon's damage, and they count as spells.

Choose one of the following smite options or one of the smite options available at earlier levels. You gain another option at level 13.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats, monk feats, and combat maneuver feats by default.
                        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                        
                        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

advancement.title: Sacred Oath
advancement.hint:
You formally swear a binding oath, which you can then draw power from. Your choice of sacred oath represents you choosing the values and ideals you will embody. Your oath grants you features at this level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 20th level.
        
        Sacred Oaths published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the paladin class.
        
        Your oath will have two Channel Conviction options. If you choose an oath that's not from Elkan 5e, these will be labeled as 'Channel Divinity'. At this level, you choose one of them, which you can use once between every short or long rest. The other you then gain at level 10.

 For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
